net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.validation

Interface Validator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractValidator, ButtonSelectedValidator, CompositeValidator, DoubleEntryValidator, DoubleRangeValidator, DoubleValidator, EmailValidator, FloatValidator, IntegerValidator, LongRangeValidator, LongValidator, NumberValidator, PassAllValidator, RegularExpressionValidator, RequiredLocalizationValidator, RequiredValueValidator, StringValueValidator, ValidMarkupValidator, ValidRegularExpressionValidator, ValidURIValidator, ValidURLValidator, XMLFragmentMIWTValidator
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Validator
    Defines data validation for a component.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean isComponentValidationSupported(Component component)
      Determine if this validator instance can be used with the given component.
      boolean validate(Component component, Notifiable notifiable)
      Validate the specified component.

    • Method Detail

      • isComponentValidationSupported

        default boolean isComponentValidationSupported(Component component)
        Determine if this validator instance can be used with the given component.

        This is useful for reusable validators to implement and declare what components they support.

        Parameters:
        component - The component.
        Returns:
        true if this validator supports the given component, otherwise false.

      • validate

        boolean validate(Component component,
                 Notifiable notifiable)
        Validate the specified component.
        Parameters:
        component - the component to validate.
        notifiable - the notifiable to send notifications.
        Returns:
        true if the component data is valid, otherwise false.
